item.title: Facebook Just Bought Oculus
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“Revamp dis Shit, post:17, topic:541538”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=660409.msg4416091#msg4416091 date=1395987129]

Dafuq is oculus?
Some minecraft shit?

What

What

Oculus was (is?) the most promising Virtual Reality helmet in development. Everyone was happy about it. There were plans for prawns on it, minecraft, and a bunch of other awesome stuff. Then big ol’ Facebook comes in and buys them out for $2 billion and caused a huge panic because they’re not a game company, which also made a lot of companies pull from developing on the Oculus.
[/quote]
A virtual reality helmet… sounds cheesy as hell.
Sounds like it isn’t gonna be the most promising anymore.[/quote]

It’s more of a headset. I’ve personally bought one and I think you’re lacking of vision.

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook Just Bought Oculus
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:13, topic:541538”]Honestly… I think everyone is blowing this out of proportion. Everything that FaceBook has ever bought has not crashed. Take Instagram for example. Its doing wonderful right now.

I personally think that a small project like Oculus that was originally being created and funded off donations can do a lot better now that it is backed by a multi billion dollar company. Hope to see great things come out of this.[/quote]
Facebook is a social networking company, instagram is another element of social networking. Generally, everything facebook has purchased was related to social networking, which would make sense. Facebook is not a gaming company, and has never been one. So when they came out and bought this for $2 billion, it turned some heads. And I have to agree with Notch, as he brings up a lot of valid points:

"Facebook is not a game tech company," Notch writes. "Facebook has a history of caring about building user numbers, and nothing but building user numbers. People have made games for Facebook platforms before, and while it worked great for a while, they were stuck in a very unfortunate position when Facebook eventually changed the platform to better fit the social experience they were trying to build."

Persson admits that social could be huge for VR, but emphasizes, “I don’t want to work with social, I want to work with games.” Furthermore, Persson doesn’t trust Facebook as an entity. “I definitely want to be a part of VR, but I will not work with Facebook. Their motives are too unclear and shifting, and they haven’t historically been a stable platform. There’s nothing about their history that makes me trust them, and that makes them seem creepy to me.”

He concludes, “I’d like to congratulate both Facebook and the Oculus owners. But this is where we part ways.”

Source: http://www.ign.com/articles/2014/03/25/notch-minecraft-on-oculus-canceled-facebook-creeps-me-out

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook Just Bought Oculus
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Honestly… I think everyone is blowing this out of proportion. Everything that FaceBook has ever bought has not crashed. Take Instagram for example. Its doing wonderful right now.

I personally think that a small project like Oculus that was originally being created and funded off donations can do a lot better now that it is backed by a multi billion dollar company. Hope to see great things come out of this.
